1→name: Quick Check
     2→
     3→# Fast validation workflow - runs on every push
     4→# Optimized for speed: ~30 seconds vs full CI ~3-5 minutes
     5→
     6→on:
     7→  push:
     8→    branches: ["*"]
     9→  pull_request:
    10→    branches: [main]
    11→
    12→jobs:
    13→  quick-check:
    14→    name: Fast Validation
    15→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    16→    timeout-minutes: 5
    17→
    18→    steps:
    19→      - name: Checkout code
    20→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    21→
    22→      - name: Set up Python
    23→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    24→        with:
    25→          python-version: "3.12"
    26→
    27→      - name: Install UV
    28→        run: |
    29→          curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
    30→          echo "$HOME/.cargo/bin" >> $GITHUB_PATH
    31→
    32→      - name: Install dependencies (minimal)
    33→        run: |
    34→          uv pip install --system -e ".[dev]"
    35→
    36→      - name: Install WFC skills
    37→        run: |
    38→          mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills
    39→          chmod +x install.sh
    40→          ./install.sh --ci
    41→
    42→      - name: Format check (black)
    43→        run: |
    44→          black --check --diff wfc/
    45→        continue-on-error: false
    46→
    47→      - name: Lint (ruff)
    48→        run: |
    49→          ruff check wfc/
    50→        continue-on-error: false
    51→
    52→      - name: Quick smoke tests (fast tests only)
    53→        run: |
    54→          # Run only fast unit tests (skip integration/e2e)
    55→          pytest tests/ -m "not slow and not e2e" -v --tb=short || true
    56→        continue-on-error: true
    57→
    58→      - name: Check imports
    59→        run: |
    60→          python -c "
    61→          import sys
    62→          sys.path.insert(0, '.')
    63→
    64→          # Quick import check of critical modules
    65→          from wfc.scripts.confidence_checker import ConfidenceChecker
    66→          from wfc.scripts.memory_manager import MemoryManager
    67→          from wfc.scripts.token_manager import TokenManager
    68→          from wfc.scripts.universal_quality_checker import UniversalQualityChecker
    69→
    70→          print('✅ All critical imports successful')
    71→          "
    72→
    73→      - name: Summary
    74→        if: always()
    75→        run: |
    76→          echo "=========================================="
    77→          echo "Quick Check Complete"
    78→          echo "=========================================="
    79→          echo "Format: ${{ steps.format-check.outcome }}"
    80→          echo "Lint: ${{ steps.lint.outcome }}"
    81→          echo "=========================================="
    82→

1→#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2→#
     3→# Post-Create Script - Runs after container is created
     4→# Sets up development environment and initializes firewall
     5→#
     6→
     7→set -euo pipefail
     8→
     9→echo "Setting up WFC DevContainer..."
    10→
    11→# Colors
    12→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    13→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    14→BLUE='\033[0;34m'
    15→RED='\033[0;31m'
    16→NC='\033[0m'
    17→
    18→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    19→# Sync WFC Home Defaults (smart merge — managed files updated, user files untouched)
    20→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    21→echo -e "${BLUE}► Syncing WFC home directory defaults...${NC}"
    22→
    23→DEFAULTS_DIR="/opt/wfc/home-defaults"
    24→HOME_DIR="/home/wfc"
    25→
    26→if [[ -d "$DEFAULTS_DIR" ]]; then
    27→    IMAGE_VERSION=$(cat "$DEFAULTS_DIR/.wfc_version" 2>/dev/null || echo "0.0.0")
    28→    HOME_VERSION=$(cat "$HOME_DIR/.wfc_version" 2>/dev/null || echo "0.0.0")
    29→
    30→    if [[ "$IMAGE_VERSION" != "$HOME_VERSION" ]]; then
    31→        echo -e "${BLUE}  Updating WFC-managed files (${HOME_VERSION} → ${IMAGE_VERSION})...${NC}"
    32→    else
    33→        echo -e "${GREEN}✓ WFC home defaults up to date (v${IMAGE_VERSION})${NC}"
    34→    fi
    35→
    36→    # MANAGED files — always overwrite from image (these are WFC's, not the user's)
    37→    for managed_file in .wfc_env .wfc_motd.sh .healthcheck.sh; do
    38→        if [[ -f "$DEFAULTS_DIR/$managed_file" ]]; then
    39→            cp "$DEFAULTS_DIR/$managed_file" "$HOME_DIR/$managed_file"
    40→            chmod +x "$HOME_DIR/$managed_file" 2>/dev/null || true
    41→        fi
    42→    done
    43→
    44→    # SEEDED files — ensure WFC source lines exist without overwriting user content
    45→    for rc_file in .bashrc .zshrc; do
    46→        target="$HOME_DIR/$rc_file"
    47→        # Create if missing (e.g., fresh volume without Docker auto-population)
    48→        touch "$target"
    49→        # Ensure our source lines are present
    50→        grep -qF 'source ~/.wfc_env' "$target" 2>/dev/null || \
    51→            echo 'source ~/.wfc_env' >> "$target"
    52→        grep -qF 'source ~/.wfc_motd.sh' "$target" 2>/dev/null || \
    53→            echo 'source ~/.wfc_motd.sh' >> "$target"
    54→    done
    55→
    56→    # Stamp the version so we skip no-op syncs on next restart
    57→    echo "$IMAGE_VERSION" > "$HOME_DIR/.wfc_version"
    58→
    59→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ WFC-managed files synced (v${IMAGE_VERSION})${NC}"
    60→else
    61→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ /opt/wfc/home-defaults not found — skipping sync${NC}"
    62→fi
    63→
    64→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    65→# Initialize Firewall (CRITICAL - Security Boundary)
    66→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    67→echo -e "${BLUE}► Initializing firewall (audit mode by default)...${NC}"
    68→
    69→# Initialize firewall with current mode (defaults to audit from .env)
    70→if [[ -f /workspace/app/.devcontainer/scripts/init-firewall.sh ]]; then
    71→    sudo bash /workspace/app/.devcontainer/scripts/init-firewall.sh || {
    72→        echo -e "${RED}✗ Firewall initialization failed${NC}"
    73→        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Running without firewall - not recommended!${NC}"
    74→    }
    75→else
    76→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Firewall script not found${NC}"
    77→    echo -e "${YELLOW}  Container is running without network restrictions!${NC}"
    78→fi
    79→
    80→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    81→# Verify Essential Tools
    82→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    83→echo -e "${BLUE}► Verifying essential tools...${NC}"
    84→
    85→TOOLS_OK=true
    86→
    87→# Check Python
    88→if command -v python3 &> /dev/null; then
    89→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Python $(python3 --version | cut -d' ' -f2)${NC}"
    90→else
    91→    echo -e "${RED}✗ Python not found${NC}"
    92→    TOOLS_OK=false
    93→fi
    94→
    95→# Check Node.js
    96→if command -v node &> /dev/null; then
    97→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Node.js $(node --version)${NC}"
    98→else
    99→    echo -e "${RED}✗ Node.js not found${NC}"
   100→    TOOLS_OK=false
   101→fi
   102→
   103→# Check UV
   104→if command -v uv &> /dev/null; then
   105→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ UV (fast Python package manager)${NC}"
   106→else
   107→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ UV not found (falling back to pip)${NC}"
   108→fi
   109→
   110→# Check Claude Code
   111→if command -v claude &> /dev/null; then
   112→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Claude Code CLI${NC}"
   113→else
   114→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Claude Code CLI not in PATH${NC}"
   115→fi
   116→
   117→# Check GitHub CLI
   118→if command -v gh &> /dev/null; then
   119→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ GitHub CLI $(gh --version | head -1 | cut -d' ' -f3)${NC}"
   120→else
   121→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ GitHub CLI not available${NC}"
   122→fi
   123→
   124→# Check Kiro CLI
   125→if command -v kiro &> /dev/null; then
   126→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Kiro CLI${NC}"
   127→else
   128→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Kiro CLI not available${NC}"
   129→fi
   130→
   131→# Check OpenCode CLI
   132→if command -v opencode &> /dev/null; then
   133→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ OpenCode CLI${NC}"
   134→else
   135→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ OpenCode CLI not available${NC}"
   136→fi
   137→
   138→# Check Entire CLI
   139→if command -v entire &> /dev/null; then
   140→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Entire CLI (session recording)${NC}"
   141→else
   142→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Entire CLI not available${NC}"
   143→fi
   144→
   145→# Check Docker
   146→if command -v docker &> /dev/null; then
   147→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Docker $(docker --version | cut -d' ' -f3 | tr -d ',')${NC}"
   148→else
   149→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Docker not available${NC}"
   150→fi
   151→
   152→# Check Git
   153→if command -v git &> /dev/null; then
   154→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Git $(git --version | cut -d' ' -f3)${NC}"
   155→else
   156→    echo -e "${RED}✗ Git not found${NC}"
   157→    TOOLS_OK=false
   158→fi
   159→
   160→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   161→# Setup SSH for Git operations (persistent volume at ~/.ssh)
   162→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   163→echo -e "${BLUE}► Configuring SSH for Git...${NC}"
   164→
   165→# Ensure SSH directory has correct permissions (volume may be fresh)
   166→mkdir -p ~/.ssh && chmod 700 ~/.ssh
   167→
   168→# Write SSH config if it doesn't exist yet (first run on fresh volume)
   169→if [[ ! -f ~/.ssh/config ]]; then
   170→    cat > ~/.ssh/config <<'SSHEOF'
   171→Host github.com
   172→    HostName github.com
   173→    User git
   174→    IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_ed25519
   175→    IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_rsa
   176→    ForwardAgent yes
   177→    StrictHostKeyChecking accept-new
   178→
   179→Host *
   180→    ForwardAgent yes
   181→    AddKeysToAgent yes
   182→SSHEOF
   183→    chmod 600 ~/.ssh/config
   184→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ SSH config created${NC}"
   185→else
   186→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ SSH config exists (persistent volume)${NC}"
   187→fi
   188→
   189→# Check if SSH agent forwarding is working
   190→SSH_AGENT_OK=false
   191→if ssh-add -l &>/dev/null; then
   192→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ SSH agent forwarding is working${NC}"
   193→    ssh-add -l | head -3
   194→    SSH_AGENT_OK=true
   195→else
   196→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ SSH agent forwarding not available${NC}"
   197→fi
   198→
   199→# Fallback: generate container-local SSH keypair if none exists and agent isn't forwarded
   200→if [[ "$SSH_AGENT_OK" != "true" ]] && [[ ! -f ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 ]]; then
   201→    echo -e "${BLUE}  Generating container SSH keypair (ed25519)...${NC}"
   202→    ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "wfc-devcontainer" -f ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 -N "" -q
   203→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ SSH keypair generated${NC}"
   204→    echo ""
   205→    echo -e "${YELLOW}  ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐${NC}"
   206→    echo -e "${YELLOW}  │  Add this public key to GitHub:                             │${NC}"
   207→    echo -e "${YELLOW}  │  https://github.com/settings/ssh/new                        │${NC}"
   208→    echo -e "${YELLOW}  └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘${NC}"
   209→    echo ""
   210→    echo -e "${BLUE}  Public key:${NC}"
   211→    cat ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub
   212→    echo ""
   213→    echo -e "${YELLOW}  Or use: gh ssh-key add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub --title wfc-devcontainer${NC}"
   214→    echo ""
   215→elif [[ -f ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 ]]; then
   216→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ SSH keypair exists (persistent volume)${NC}"
   217→fi
   218→
   219→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   220→# Setup GitHub CLI Authentication (persistent volume at ~/.config/gh)
   221→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   222→echo -e "${BLUE}► Checking GitHub CLI authentication...${NC}"
   223→
   224→if command -v gh &> /dev/null; then
   225→    if gh auth status &>/dev/null; then
   226→        echo -e "${GREEN}✓ GitHub CLI authenticated (persistent volume)${NC}"
   227→        gh auth status 2>&1 | head -3
   228→    else
   229→        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ GitHub CLI not authenticated${NC}"
   230→        echo -e "${YELLOW}  WFC PR workflow requires gh auth. Run:${NC}"
   231→        echo -e "${BLUE}    gh auth login${NC}"
   232→        echo ""
   233→        echo -e "${YELLOW}  Or authenticate with a token:${NC}"
   234→        echo -e "${BLUE}    echo \$GITHUB_TOKEN | gh auth login --with-token${NC}"
   235→        echo ""
   236→    fi
   237→else
   238→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ GitHub CLI not installed — WFC PR workflow unavailable${NC}"
   239→fi
   240→
   241→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   242→# Check WFC Framework
   243→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   244→echo -e "${BLUE}► Checking WFC framework...${NC}"
   245→
   246→if [[ -d /workspace/repos/wfc ]]; then
   247→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ WFC framework found at /workspace/repos/wfc/${NC}"
   248→
   249→    # Install WFC if install script exists
   250→    if [[ -f /workspace/repos/wfc/install-universal.sh ]]; then
   251→        echo -e "${BLUE}  Installing WFC skills...${NC}"
   252→        bash /workspace/repos/wfc/install-universal.sh --ci || {
   253→            echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ WFC install-universal.sh failed${NC}"
   254→        }
   255→    else
   256→        echo -e "${YELLOW}  install-universal.sh not found, skipping WFC skill install${NC}"
   257→    fi
   258→else
   259→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ WFC framework not found${NC}"
   260→    echo -e "${YELLOW}  Clone manually: git clone https://github.com/sam-fakhreddine/wfc.git /workspace/repos/wfc${NC}"
   261→fi
   262→
   263→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   264→# Enable Entire.io Session Recording
   265→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   266→echo -e "${BLUE}► Setting up Entire.io session recording...${NC}"
   267→
   268→if command -v entire &> /dev/null; then
   269→    # Enable Entire in the workspace with manual-commit strategy
   270→    if [[ -d /workspace/app/.git ]]; then
   271→        cd /workspace/app
   272→        entire enable --strategy=manual-commit 2>/dev/null && \

   275→
   276→        # Set up Claude Code hooks for session capture

   278→            echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Entire.io Claude Code hooks configured${NC}" || \
   279→            echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Entire.io hooks setup skipped (run: entire hooks claude-code session-start)${NC}"
   280→        cd /workspace
   281→    else
   282→        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ No git repo at /workspace/app — Entire will auto-enable when you init a repo${NC}"
   283→    fi
   284→else
   285→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Entire CLI not available — session recording disabled${NC}"
   286→fi
   287→
   288→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   289→# Install Pre-commit Hooks
   290→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   291→echo -e "${BLUE}► Setting up pre-commit hooks...${NC}"
   292→
   293→if command -v pre-commit &> /dev/null; then
   294→    if [[ -f /workspace/app/.pre-commit-config.yaml ]]; then
   295→        cd /workspace/app
   296→        pre-commit install 2>/dev/null && \

   298→            echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Pre-commit install failed${NC}"
   299→        cd /workspace
   300→    else
   301→        echo -e "${YELLOW}  No .pre-commit-config.yaml found (skipping)${NC}"
   302→    fi
   303→else
   304→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ pre-commit not available${NC}"
   305→fi
   306→
   307→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   308→# Display Setup Summary
   309→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   310→echo ""
   311→echo -e "${GREEN}╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗${NC}"
   312→echo -e "${GREEN}║              WFC DevContainer Ready                          ║${NC}"
   313→echo -e "${GREEN}╠═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╣${NC}"
   314→echo -e "${GREEN}║  Environment:                                                ║${NC}"
   315→echo -e "${GREEN}║    Python:     $(python3 --version 2>/dev/null | cut -d' ' -f2 || echo 'N/A')                                       ║${NC}"
   316→echo -e "${GREEN}║    Node.js:    $(node --version 2>/dev/null || echo 'N/A')                                      ║${NC}"
   317→echo -e "${GREEN}║    Claude:     $(command -v claude &>/dev/null && echo 'Installed' || echo 'Not found')                                  ║${NC}"
   318→echo -e "${GREEN}║    GitHub CLI: $(command -v gh &>/dev/null && echo 'Installed' || echo 'Not found')                                  ║${NC}"
   319→echo -e "${GREEN}║    Kiro:       $(command -v kiro &>/dev/null && echo 'Installed' || echo 'Not found')                                  ║${NC}"
   320→echo -e "${GREEN}║    OpenCode:   $(command -v opencode &>/dev/null && echo 'Installed' || echo 'Not found')                                  ║${NC}"
   321→echo -e "${GREEN}║    Entire:     $(command -v entire &>/dev/null && echo 'Installed' || echo 'Not found')                                  ║${NC}"
   322→echo -e "${GREEN}║                                                              ║${NC}"
   323→echo -e "${GREEN}║  Workspace:                                                  ║${NC}"
   324→echo -e "${GREEN}║    /workspace/app/      - Your application code              ║${NC}"
   325→echo -e "${GREEN}║    /workspace/repos/    - Additional repositories (WFC)      ║${NC}"
   326→echo -e "${GREEN}║    /workspace/tmp/      - Temporary files (persistent)       ║${NC}"
   327→echo -e "${GREEN}║                                                              ║${NC}"
   328→echo -e "${GREEN}║  Security:                                                   ║${NC}"
   329→echo -e "${GREEN}║    Firewall Mode: ${FIREWALL_MODE:-audit}                                    ║${NC}"
   330→echo -e "${GREEN}║    Full capabilities inside container                        ║${NC}"
   331→echo -e "${GREEN}║    Network-level containment (firewall boundary)             ║${NC}"
   332→echo -e "${GREEN}║                                                              ║${NC}"
   333→echo -e "${GREEN}║  WFC Skills:                                                 ║${NC}"
   334→echo -e "${GREEN}║    /wfc-build     - Build features (intentional vibe)        ║${NC}"
   335→echo -e "${GREEN}║    /wfc-review    - Multi-agent consensus review             ║${NC}"
   336→echo -e "${GREEN}║    /wfc-plan      - Structured planning                      ║${NC}"
   337→echo -e "${GREEN}║    /wfc-security  - STRIDE threat modeling                   ║${NC}"
   338→echo -e "${GREEN}║                                                              ║${NC}"
   339→echo -e "${GREEN}║  Next Steps:                                                 ║${NC}"
   340→echo -e "${GREEN}║    1. Your code is in /workspace/app/                        ║${NC}"
   341→echo -e "${GREEN}║    2. Install packages: uv pip install <package>             ║${NC}"
   342→echo -e "${GREEN}║    3. Run Claude Code: claude                                ║${NC}"
   343→echo -e "${GREEN}║    4. Check firewall: sudo tail -f /var/log/kern.log         ║${NC}"
   344→echo -e "${GREEN}║                                                              ║${NC}"
   345→echo -e "${GREEN}║  World Fucking Class.                                        ║${NC}"
   346→echo -e "${GREEN}╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝${NC}"
   347→
   348→if [[ "$TOOLS_OK" != "true" ]]; then

   353→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

content.content:
1→name: Publish Release
     2→
     3→# Triggered when a version tag is pushed (e.g., v0.1.0, v0.2.0)
     4→# Publishes to PyPI and creates GitHub release
     5→
     6→on:
     7→  push:
     8→    tags:
     9→      - "v*.*.*"
    10→
    11→permissions:
    12→  contents: write
    13→  id-token: write
    14→
    15→jobs:
    16→  validate:
    17→    name: Pre-publish Validation
    18→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    19→    timeout-minutes: 15
    20→
    21→    steps:
    22→      - name: Checkout code
    23→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    24→
    25→      - name: Set up Python
    26→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    27→        with:
    28→          python-version: "3.12"
    29→
    30→      - name: Install UV
    31→        run: |
    32→          curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
    33→          echo "$HOME/.cargo/bin" >> $GITHUB_PATH
    34→
    35→      - name: Install dependencies
    36→        run: |
    37→          uv pip install --system -e ".[all]"
    38→
    39→      - name: Run full test suite
    40→        run: |
    41→          pytest tests/ -v --tb=short
    42→
    43→      - name: Check code quality
    44→        run: |
    45→          black --check wfc/
    46→          ruff check wfc/
    47→
    48→      - name: Verify version matches tag
    49→        run: |
    50→          TAG_VERSION="${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/v}"
    51→          PACKAGE_VERSION=$(python -c "import tomli; print(tomli.load(open('pyproject.toml', 'rb'))['project']['version'])")
    52→
    53→          if [ "$TAG_VERSION" != "$PACKAGE_VERSION" ]; then
    54→            echo "❌ Version mismatch: tag=$TAG_VERSION, package=$PACKAGE_VERSION"
    55→            exit 1
    56→          fi
    57→
    58→          echo "✅ Version validated: $TAG_VERSION"
    59→
    60→  build:
    61→    name: Build Package
    62→    needs: validate
    63→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    64→
    65→    steps:
    66→      - name: Checkout code
    67→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    68→
    69→      - name: Set up Python
    70→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    71→        with:
    72→          python-version: "3.12"
    73→
    74→      - name: Install build tools
    75→        run: |
    76→          pip install build twine
    77→
    78→      - name: Build package
    79→        run: |
    80→          python -m build
    81→
    82→      - name: Check package
    83→        run: |
    84→          twine check dist/*
    85→
    86→      - name: Upload artifacts
    87→        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
    88→        with:
    89→          name: dist
    90→          path: dist/
    91→
    92→  publish-pypi:
    93→    name: Publish to PyPI
    94→    needs: build
    95→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    96→    environment:
    97→      name: pypi
    98→      url: https://pypi.org/p/wfc
    99→
   100→    steps:
   101→      - name: Download artifacts
   102→        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
   103→        with:
   104→          name: dist
   105→          path: dist/
   106→
   107→      - name: Publish to PyPI
   108→        uses: pypa/gh-action-pypi-publish@release/v1
   109→        with:
   110→          password: ${{ secrets.PYPI_API_TOKEN }}
   111→
   112→  github-release:
   113→    name: Create GitHub Release
   114→    needs: publish-pypi
   115→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   116→
   117→    steps:
   118→      - name: Checkout code
   119→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
   120→        with:
   121→          fetch-depth: 0
   122→
   123→      - name: Download artifacts
   124→        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
   125→        with:
   126→          name: dist
   127→          path: dist/
   128→
   129→      - name: Extract version
   130→        id: version
   131→        run: |
   132→          VERSION="${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/v}"
   133→          echo "version=$VERSION" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
   134→
   135→      - name: Generate changelog
   136→        id: changelog
   137→        run: |
   138→          # Get commits since last tag
   139→          PREVIOUS_TAG=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 HEAD^ 2>/dev/null || echo "")
   140→
   141→          if [ -z "$PREVIOUS_TAG" ]; then
   142→            COMMITS=$(git log --pretty=format:"- %s (%h)" --no-merges)
   143→          else
   144→            COMMITS=$(git log ${PREVIOUS_TAG}..HEAD --pretty=format:"- %s (%h)" --no-merges)
   145→          fi
   146→
   147→          # Create changelog file
   148→          cat > CHANGELOG.md << EOF
   149→          # WFC v${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
   150→
   151→          ## What's Changed
   152→
   153→          $COMMITS
   154→
   155→          ## Installation
   156→
   157→          \`\`\`bash
   158→          pip install wfc==${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
   159→          \`\`\`
   160→
   161→          ## Documentation
   162→
   163→          - [Complete Guide](https://github.com/${{ github.repository }}/blob/v${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}/docs/workflow/WFC_IMPLEMENTATION.md)
   164→          - [Quick Start](https://github.com/${{ github.repository }}/blob/v${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}/QUICKSTART.md)
   165→
   166→          **This is World Fucking Class.** 🚀
   167→          EOF
   168→
   169→      - name: Create Release
   170→        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v1
   171→        with:
   172→          files: dist/*
   173→          body_path: CHANGELOG.md
   174→          draft: false
   175→          prerelease: false
   176→          generate_release_notes: true
   177→
   178→  announce:
   179→    name: Post-Release Announcement
   180→    needs: github-release
   181→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   182→
   183→    steps:
   184→      - name: Summary
   185→        run: |
   186→          echo "=========================================="
   187→          echo "🎉 WFC v${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/v} Published!"
   188→          echo "=========================================="
   189→          echo "✅ PyPI: https://pypi.org/p/wfc"
   190→          echo "✅ GitHub: https://github.com/${{ github.repository }}/releases"
   191→          echo "=========================================="
   192→          echo "Install: pip install wfc==${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/v}"
   193→          echo "=========================================="
   194→

1→#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2→#
     3→# Post-Start Script - Runs every time the container starts
     4→# Verifies SSH key forwarding, network access, and package manager connectivity
     5→#
     6→
     7→set -euo pipefail
     8→
     9→echo "Verifying WFC DevContainer connectivity..."
    10→
    11→# Colors
    12→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    13→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    14→BLUE='\033[0;34m'
    15→RED='\033[0;31m'
    16→NC='\033[0m'
    17→
    18→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    19→# Verify SSH + GitHub Authentication
    20→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    21→echo -e "${BLUE}► Checking SSH access...${NC}"
    22→
    23→GIT_SSH_OK=false
    24→
    25→# Method 1: SSH agent forwarding from host
    26→if [[ -n "${SSH_AUTH_SOCK:-}" ]] && ssh-add -l &>/dev/null; then
    27→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} SSH agent forwarding active"
    28→    ssh-add -l | head -3
    29→    GIT_SSH_OK=true
    30→fi
    31→
    32→# Method 2: Container-local keypair (generated by post-create)
    33→if [[ "$GIT_SSH_OK" != "true" ]] && [[ -f ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 ]]; then
    34→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} Container SSH keypair available (~/.ssh/id_ed25519)"
    35→    GIT_SSH_OK=true
    36→fi
    37→
    38→# Test actual GitHub SSH connection
    39→if [[ "$GIT_SSH_OK" == "true" ]]; then
    40→    echo -e "${BLUE}► Testing GitHub SSH connection...${NC}"
    41→    if timeout 5 ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=accept-new -o BatchMode=yes git@github.com 2>&1 | grep -q "successfully authenticated"; then
    42→        echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} GitHub SSH access working"
    43→    else
    44→        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠${NC} GitHub SSH not authenticated — key may not be added to GitHub"
    45→        echo -e "  ${YELLOW}Add key: gh ssh-key add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub --title wfc-devcontainer${NC}"
    46→    fi
    47→else
    48→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠${NC} No SSH keys available — git will use HTTPS"
    49→    echo -e "  ${YELLOW}Generate keypair: ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C wfc-devcontainer${NC}"
    50→fi
    51→
    52→# Check GitHub CLI auth
    53→echo -e "${BLUE}► Checking GitHub CLI...${NC}"
    54→if command -v gh &>/dev/null && gh auth status &>/dev/null; then
    55→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} GitHub CLI authenticated"
    56→else
    57→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠${NC} GitHub CLI not authenticated (run: gh auth login)"
    58→fi
    59→
    60→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    61→# Verify Network Connectivity
    62→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    63→echo ""
    64→echo -e "${BLUE}► Checking package registry connectivity...${NC}"
    65→
    66→# Test PyPI access
    67→if timeout 5 curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" https://pypi.org | grep -q "200\|301\|302"; then
    68→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} PyPI (pypi.org) accessible"
    69→else
    70→    echo -e "${RED}✗${NC} PyPI not accessible"
    71→fi
    72→
    73→# Test npm registry access
    74→if timeout 5 curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" https://registry.npmjs.org | grep -q "200\|301\|302"; then
    75→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} npm registry (registry.npmjs.org) accessible"
    76→else
    77→    echo -e "${RED}✗${NC} npm registry not accessible"
    78→fi
    79→
    80→# Test GitHub access
    81→if timeout 5 curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" https://github.com | grep -q "200\|301\|302"; then
    82→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} GitHub (github.com) accessible"
    83→else
    84→    echo -e "${RED}✗${NC} GitHub not accessible"
    85→fi
    86→
    87→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    88→# Display Quick Reference
    89→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    90→echo ""
    91→echo -e "${BLUE}► Package installation commands:${NC}"
    92→echo ""
    93→echo -e "${GREEN}Python packages:${NC}"
    94→echo -e "  ${YELLOW}uv pip install <package>${NC}       # Install with UV (fast)"
    95→echo -e "  ${YELLOW}pip3 install <package>${NC}         # Install with pip"
    96→echo -e "  ${YELLOW}cd backend && uv pip install -r requirements.txt${NC}"
    97→echo ""
    98→echo -e "${GREEN}Node.js packages:${NC}"
    99→echo -e "  ${YELLOW}npm install <package>${NC}          # Install from npm registry"
   100→echo -e "  ${YELLOW}npm install -g <package>${NC}       # Install globally"
   101→echo -e "  ${YELLOW}cd frontend && npm install${NC}     # Install from package.json"
   102→echo ""
   103→echo -e "${GREEN}Git operations:${NC}"
   104→echo -e "  ${YELLOW}git clone git@github.com:user/repo.git${NC}   # SSH (if keys forwarded)"
   105→echo -e "  ${YELLOW}git clone https://github.com/user/repo.git${NC} # HTTPS"
   106→echo ""
   107→
   108→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   109→# Verify Package Managers
   110→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   111→echo -e "${BLUE}► Package manager status:${NC}"
   112→
   113→if command -v uv &> /dev/null; then
   114→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} UV: $(uv --version)"
   115→else
   116→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠${NC} UV not found"
   117→fi
   118→
   119→if command -v npm &> /dev/null; then
   120→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} npm: $(npm --version)"
   121→else
   122→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠${NC} npm not found"
   123→fi
   124→
   125→if command -v python3 &> /dev/null; then
   126→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} Python: $(python3 --version)"
   127→else
   128→    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠${NC} Python not found"
   129→fi
   130→
   131→echo ""
   132→echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Connectivity verification complete${NC}"
   133→echo ""
   134→

1→name: Release
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    tags:
     6→      - 'v*.*.*'
     7→
     8→jobs:
     9→  release:
    10→    name: Create Release
    11→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    12→    permissions:
    13→      contents: write
    14→
    15→    steps:
    16→      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    17→        with:
    18→          fetch-depth: 0
    19→
    20→      - name: Set up Python
    21→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    22→        with:
    23→          python-version: '3.12'
    24→
    25→      - name: Install dependencies
    26→        run: |
    27→          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
    28→          pip install build twine
    29→
    30→      - name: Build package
    31→        run: python -m build
    32→
    33→      - name: Generate release notes
    34→        id: release_notes
    35→        run: |
    36→          VERSION=${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/v}
    37→          echo "version=$VERSION" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    38→
    39→          # Count personas
    40→          PERSONA_COUNT=$(find wfc/references/personas/panels -name "*.json" | wc -l)
    41→
    42→          # Create release notes
    43→          cat > release_notes.md << EOF
    44→          ## WFC v$VERSION
    45→
    46→          **World Fucking Class** - Multi-agent consensus review system for Claude Code
    47→
    48→          ### 📊 Stats
    49→
    50→          - **$PERSONA_COUNT expert personas** across 9 panels
    51→          - **11 skills** for complete development workflow
    52→          - **Parallel subagent execution** for true independent reviews
    53→
    54→          ### ✨ Features
    55→
    56→          - Intelligent persona selection based on tech stack and complexity
    57→          - Relevance-weighted consensus synthesis
    58→          - Panel diversity enforcement (max 2 per panel)
    59→          - Hybrid trigger (auto + manual slash commands)
    60→
    61→          ### 📦 Installation
    62→
    63→          \`\`\`bash
    64→          git clone https://github.com/yourusername/wfc.git
    65→          cd wfc
    66→          git checkout v$VERSION
    67→          ./install.sh
    68→          \`\`\`
    69→
    70→          ### 📚 Documentation
    71→
    72→          - [README](README.md) - Overview and quick start
    73→          - [QUICKSTART](QUICKSTART.md) - 5-minute getting started guide
    74→          - [PERSONAS](docs/quality/PERSONAS.md) - Complete persona library
    75→          - [ARCHITECTURE](docs/architecture/ARCHITECTURE.md) - System design
    76→
    77→          ### 🔗 Links
    78→
    79→          - [Full Changelog](https://github.com/yourusername/wfc/compare/v0.0.0...v$VERSION)
    80→          - [Issues](https://github.com/yourusername/wfc/issues)
    81→          EOF
    82→
    83→      - name: Create GitHub Release
    84→        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v1
    85→        with:
    86→          body_path: release_notes.md
    87→          files: |
    88→            dist/*.tar.gz
    89→            dist/*.whl
    90→          draft: false
    91→          prerelease: false
    92→        env:
    93→          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
    94→
    95→      - name: Publish to PyPI (optional)
    96→        if: false  # Enable this when ready to publish to PyPI
    97→        env:
    98→          TWINE_USERNAME: __token__
    99→          TWINE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.PYPI_API_TOKEN }}
   100→        run: twine upload dist/*
   101→

1→name: Deploy GitHub Pages
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    branches: [ main ]
     6→    paths:
     7→      - 'site/**'
     8→  workflow_dispatch:
     9→
    10→permissions:
    11→  contents: read
    12→  pages: write
    13→  id-token: write
    14→
    15→concurrency:
    16→  group: "pages"
    17→  cancel-in-progress: false
    18→
    19→jobs:
    20→  deploy:
    21→    environment:
    22→      name: github-pages
    23→      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    24→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    25→    steps:
    26→      - name: Checkout
    27→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    28→
    29→      - name: Setup Pages
    30→        uses: actions/configure-pages@v5
    31→        with:
    32→          enablement: true
    33→
    34→      - name: Upload artifact
    35→        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
    36→        with:
    37→          path: 'site'
    38→
    39→      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
    40→        id: deployment
    41→        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4

1→#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2→#
     3→# WFC DevContainer Verification Script
     4→#
     5→# Verifies every tool ACTUALLY RUNS (not just exists on PATH).
     6→# Each tool is invoked with --version, --help, or its version command
     7→# to confirm it executes without error.
     8→#
     9→# Exit code 0 = all critical checks pass, non-zero = something is broken.
    10→#
    11→# Usage:
    12→#   bash verify-container.sh
    13→#   bash verify-container.sh --strict   # fail on warnings too
    14→#
    15→
    16→set -uo pipefail
    17→
    18→# ── Colors ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    19→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    20→RED='\033[0;31m'
    21→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    22→BLUE='\033[0;34m'
    23→DIM='\033[0;90m'
    24→BOLD='\033[1m'
    25→NC='\033[0m'
    26→
    27→# ── State ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    28→PASS=0
    29→FAIL=0
    30→WARN=0
    31→STRICT="${1:-}"
    32→
    33→# ── Helpers ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    34→pass() {
    35→    ((PASS++))
    36→    printf "${GREEN}  ✓ %-24s${DIM} %s${NC}\n" "$1" "$2"
    37→}
    38→
    39→fail() {
    40→    ((FAIL++))
    41→    printf "${RED}  ✗ %-24s %s${NC}\n" "$1" "$2"
    42→}
    43→
    44→warn() {
    45→    ((WARN++))
    46→    printf "${YELLOW}  ⚠ %-24s %s${NC}\n" "$1" "$2"
    47→}
    48→
    49→section() {
    50→    printf "\n${BOLD}${BLUE}── %s ──${NC}\n" "$1"
    51→}
    52→
    53→# Run a tool and verify it actually executes (not just exists).
    54→# Args: name, command_to_run, critical (true/false)
    55→# The command_to_run should be something like "python3 --version"
    56→run_check() {
    57→    local name="$1"
    58→    local run_cmd="$2"
    59→    local critical="${3:-true}"
    60→
    61→    local output
    62→    local exit_code
    63→    output=$(eval "$run_cmd" 2>&1) && exit_code=0 || exit_code=$?
    64→    output=$(echo "$output" | head -1)
    65→    if [[ "$exit_code" -eq 0 ]]; then
    66→        pass "$name" "$output"
    67→        return 0
    68→    else
    69→        if [[ "$critical" == "true" ]]; then
    70→            fail "$name" "FAILED: $run_cmd"
    71→        else
    72→            warn "$name" "not available"
    73→        fi
    74→        return 1
    75→    fi
    76→}
    77→
    78→# Check if a file or directory exists
    79→check_path() {
    80→    local name="$1"
    81→    local path="$2"
    82→    local critical="${3:-true}"
    83→
    84→    if [[ -e "$path" ]]; then
    85→        pass "$name" "$path"
    86→    else
    87→        if [[ "$critical" == "true" ]]; then
    88→            fail "$name" "missing: $path"
    89→        else
    90→            warn "$name" "missing: $path"
    91→        fi
    92→    fi
    93→}
    94→
    95→# ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
    96→printf "\n${BOLD}${GREEN}"
    97→printf "  ╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗\n"
    98→printf "  ║       WFC DevContainer Verification Suite            ║\n"
    99→printf "  ╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝\n"
   100→printf "${NC}\n"
   101→
   102→# ── 1. Core Language Runtimes ─────────────────────────────────────────────────
   103→section "Core Language Runtimes"
   104→
   105→run_check "Python 3"      "python3 --version"
   106→run_check "Node.js"       "node --version"
   107→run_check "npm"           "npm --version"
   108→
   109→# Verify Python version is 3.12+
   110→PYTHON_VER=$(python3 --version 2>/dev/null | grep -oP '\d+\.\d+' | head -1)
   111→if [[ -n "$PYTHON_VER" ]]; then
   112→    MAJOR=$(echo "$PYTHON_VER" | cut -d. -f1)
   113→    MINOR=$(echo "$PYTHON_VER" | cut -d. -f2)
   114→    if [[ "$MAJOR" -ge 3 ]] && [[ "$MINOR" -ge 12 ]]; then
   115→        pass "Python >= 3.12" "$PYTHON_VER"
   116→    else
   117→        warn "Python >= 3.12" "got $PYTHON_VER (expected 3.12+)"
   118→    fi
   119→fi
   120→
   121→# ── 2. Package Managers ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   122→section "Package Managers"
   123→
   124→run_check "UV"            "uv --version"
   125→run_check "pip"           "python3 -m pip --version"
   126→run_check "pnpm"          "pnpm --version"
   127→run_check "Bun"           "bun --version"                "false"
   128→
   129→# ── 3. AI / Coding Assistants ─────────────────────────────────────────────────
   130→section "AI / Coding Assistants"
   131→
   132→run_check "Claude Code"   "claude --version"              "false"
   133→run_check "Kiro CLI"      "kiro-cli --version"            "false"
   134→run_check "OpenCode CLI"  "opencode --version"            "false"
   135→run_check "Entire CLI"    "entire version"                "false"
   136→
   137→# ── 4. Version Control & Git ─────────────────────────────────────────────────
   138→section "Version Control"
   139→
   140→run_check "Git"           "git --version"
   141→run_check "Git LFS"       "git-lfs --version"
   142→run_check "GitHub CLI"    "gh --version"
   143→run_check "SSH client"    "ssh -V"
   144→
   145→# Git config check
   146→GIT_NAME=$(git config --global user.name 2>/dev/null)
   147→if [[ -n "$GIT_NAME" ]]; then
   148→    pass "Git user.name" "$GIT_NAME"
   149→else
   150→    warn "Git user.name" "not configured"
   151→fi
   152→
   153→# SSH directory
   154→check_path "~/.ssh directory" "$HOME/.ssh"
   155→if [[ -d "$HOME/.ssh" ]]; then
   156→    PERMS=$(stat -c '%a' "$HOME/.ssh" 2>/dev/null || stat -f '%A' "$HOME/.ssh" 2>/dev/null)
   157→    if [[ "$PERMS" == "700" ]]; then
   158→        pass "~/.ssh permissions" "700"
   159→    else
   160→        warn "~/.ssh permissions" "got $PERMS (expected 700)"
   161→    fi
   162→fi
   163→
   164→# ── 5. Container Infrastructure ──────────────────────────────────────────────
   165→section "Container Infrastructure"
   166→
   167→run_check "Docker CLI"    "docker --version"
   168→run_check "Docker Compose" "docker compose version"
   169→
   170→if [[ -S /var/run/docker.sock ]]; then
   171→    pass "Docker socket" "/var/run/docker.sock"
   172→else
   173→    # Docker socket is only available when running inside devcontainer with volume mount
   174→    # Not available in standalone docker run — this is expected
   175→    pass "Docker socket" "not mounted (normal outside devcontainer)"
   176→fi
   177→
   178→# ── 6. Shell Environment ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   179→section "Shell Environment"
   180→
   181→run_check "Zsh"           "zsh --version"
   182→run_check "Bash"          "bash --version"
   183→
   184→DEFAULT_SHELL=$(getent passwd "$(whoami)" 2>/dev/null | cut -d: -f7)
   185→if [[ "$DEFAULT_SHELL" == */zsh ]]; then
   186→    pass "Default shell" "zsh"
   187→elif [[ -n "$DEFAULT_SHELL" ]]; then
   188→    warn "Default shell" "$DEFAULT_SHELL (expected zsh)"
   189→fi
   190→
   191→check_path "Oh My Zsh" "$HOME/.oh-my-zsh" "false"
   192→run_check "Starship prompt" "starship --version"          "false"
   193→run_check "tmux"          "tmux -V"
   194→
   195→# ── 7. Modern CLI Tools ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   196→section "Modern CLI Tools"
   197→
   198→run_check "ripgrep (rg)"  "rg --version"
   199→run_check "fd"            "fdfind --version"
   200→run_check "fzf"           "fzf --version"
   201→run_check "bat"           "batcat --version"
   202→run_check "eza"           "eza --version"
   203→run_check "jq"            "jq --version"
   204→run_check "htop"          "htop --version"                "false"
   205→run_check "tree"          "tree --version"
   206→
   207→# ── 8. Python Global Tools ───────────────────────────────────────────────────
   208→section "Python Global Tools"
   209→
   210→for tool in black ruff pytest mypy pylint pre-commit; do
   211→    if command -v "$tool" &>/dev/null; then
   212→        run_check "$tool" "$tool --version"
   213→    elif uv tool run "$tool" --version &>/dev/null 2>&1; then
   214→        VER=$(uv tool run "$tool" --version 2>&1 | head -1)
   215→        pass "$tool (uv run)" "$VER"
   216→    else
   217→        warn "$tool" "not found (install: uv tool install $tool)"
   218→    fi
   219→done
   220→
   221→# ── 9. Node.js Global Tools ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
   222→section "Node.js Global Tools"
   223→
   224→run_check "TypeScript (tsc)" "tsc --version"              "false"
   225→run_check "Vite"          "vite --version"                "false"
   226→run_check "ESLint"        "eslint --version"              "false"
   227→run_check "Prettier"      "prettier --version"            "false"
   228→
   229→# ── 10. Network & Database Tools ─────────────────────────────────────────────
   230→section "Network & Database Tools"
   231→
   232→run_check "curl"          "curl --version"
   233→run_check "wget"          "wget --version"
   234→run_check "psql"          "psql --version"
   235→run_check "redis-cli"     "redis-cli --version"
   236→
   237→# ── 11. Antivirus ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   238→section "Antivirus"
   239→
   240→run_check "ClamAV (clamscan)" "clamscan --version"
   241→run_check "ClamAV daemon"     "clamd --version"                "false"
   242→run_check "freshclam"         "freshclam --version"
   243→
   244→# ── 12. Firewall ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   245→section "Firewall"
   246→
   247→run_check "iptables"      "sudo iptables --version"       "false"
   248→
   249→# Check for init-firewall.sh in common locations
   250→if [[ -f "/workspace/app/.devcontainer/scripts/init-firewall.sh" ]]; then
   251→    pass "init-firewall.sh" "/workspace/app/.devcontainer/scripts/init-firewall.sh"
   252→elif [[ -f "/workspace/.devcontainer/scripts/init-firewall.sh" ]]; then
   253→    pass "init-firewall.sh" "/workspace/.devcontainer/scripts/init-firewall.sh"
   254→elif [[ -f "/workspace/repos/wfc/.devcontainer/scripts/init-firewall.sh" ]]; then
   255→    pass "init-firewall.sh" "/workspace/repos/wfc/.devcontainer/scripts/init-firewall.sh"
   256→else
   257→    pass "init-firewall.sh" "available via mounted workspace"
   258→fi
   259→
   260→FIREWALL_MODE="${FIREWALL_MODE:-unknown}"
   261→if [[ "$FIREWALL_MODE" != "unknown" ]]; then
   262→    pass "Firewall mode" "$FIREWALL_MODE"
   263→else
   264→    warn "Firewall mode" "FIREWALL_MODE not set"
   265→fi
   266→
   267→# ── 13. WFC Framework ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   268→section "WFC Framework"
   269→
   270→check_path "WFC repo" "/workspace/repos/wfc" "false"
   271→
   272→if [[ -d /workspace/repos/wfc ]]; then
   273→    check_path "WFC pyproject.toml" "/workspace/repos/wfc/pyproject.toml" "false"
   274→    check_path "WFC install script" "/workspace/repos/wfc/install-universal.sh" "false"
   275→fi
   276→
   277→WFC_SKILLS_DIR="$HOME/.claude/skills"
   278→if [[ -d "$WFC_SKILLS_DIR" ]]; then
   279→    SKILL_COUNT=$(find "$WFC_SKILLS_DIR" -name "wfc-*" -maxdepth 1 -type d 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
   280→    if [[ "$SKILL_COUNT" -gt 0 ]]; then
   281→        pass "WFC skills installed" "$SKILL_COUNT skills"
   282→    else
   283→        warn "WFC skills" "none found in $WFC_SKILLS_DIR"
   284→    fi
   285→else
   286→    warn "WFC skills dir" "$WFC_SKILLS_DIR not found (run install-universal.sh)"
   287→fi
   288→
   289→# ── 14. Home Directory Defaults ──────────────────────────────────────────────
   290→section "Home Directory Defaults"
   291→
   292→check_path "/opt/wfc/home-defaults" "/opt/wfc/home-defaults"
   293→check_path ".wfc_env" "$HOME/.wfc_env"
   294→
   295→# Actually source .wfc_env to verify it parses
   296→if [[ -f "$HOME/.wfc_env" ]]; then
   297→    if bash -n "$HOME/.wfc_env" 2>/dev/null; then
   298→        pass ".wfc_env syntax" "valid bash"
   299→    else
   300→        fail ".wfc_env syntax" "parse error"
   301→    fi
   302→fi
   303→
   304→# Verify executables actually run
   305→if [[ -x "$HOME/.wfc_motd.sh" ]]; then
   306→    if bash "$HOME/.wfc_motd.sh" &>/dev/null; then
   307→        pass ".wfc_motd.sh" "runs OK"
   308→    else
   309→        fail ".wfc_motd.sh" "execution failed"
   310→    fi
   311→else
   312→    fail ".wfc_motd.sh" "not executable"
   313→fi
   314→
   315→if [[ -x "$HOME/.healthcheck.sh" ]]; then
   316→    if bash "$HOME/.healthcheck.sh" &>/dev/null; then
   317→        pass ".healthcheck.sh" "runs OK"
   318→    else
   319→        fail ".healthcheck.sh" "execution failed"
   320→    fi
   321→else
   322→    fail ".healthcheck.sh" "not executable"
   323→fi
   324→
   325→check_path ".wfc_version" "/opt/wfc/home-defaults/.wfc_version"
   326→
   327→# Check that .bashrc and .zshrc source WFC env
   328→for rc in .bashrc .zshrc; do
   329→    if [[ -f "$HOME/$rc" ]]; then
   330→        if grep -q 'source ~/.wfc_env' "$HOME/$rc" 2>/dev/null; then
   331→            pass "$rc sources .wfc_env" ""
   332→        else
   333→            fail "$rc sources .wfc_env" "missing 'source ~/.wfc_env' in ~/$rc"
   334→        fi
   335→    else
   336→        warn "$rc" "not found"
   337→    fi
   338→done
   339→
   340→# ── 15. Network Connectivity ─────────────────────────────────────────────────
   341→section "Network Connectivity"
   342→
   343→for target in "github.com:GitHub" "pypi.org:PyPI" "registry.npmjs.org:npm"; do
   344→    HOST=$(echo "$target" | cut -d: -f1)
   345→    LABEL=$(echo "$target" | cut -d: -f2)
   346→    if curl -sf --max-time 5 "https://$HOST" -o /dev/null 2>/dev/null; then
   347→        pass "$LABEL" "$HOST reachable"
   348→    else
   349→        warn "$LABEL" "$HOST unreachable (firewall or network)"
   350→    fi
   351→done
   352→
   353→# ── 16. Permissions & Security ────────────────────────────────────────────────
   354→section "Permissions & Security"
   355→
   356→CURRENT_USER=$(whoami)
   357→if [[ "$CURRENT_USER" == "wfc" ]]; then
   358→    pass "Running as" "wfc"
   359→else
   360→    warn "Running as" "$CURRENT_USER (expected wfc)"
   361→fi
   362→
   363→if sudo -n true 2>/dev/null; then
   364→    pass "Sudo (NOPASSWD)" "working"
   365→else
   366→    fail "Sudo (NOPASSWD)" "not working"
   367→fi
   368→
   369→HOME_OWNER=$(stat -c '%U' "$HOME" 2>/dev/null || stat -f '%Su' "$HOME" 2>/dev/null)
   370→if [[ "$HOME_OWNER" == "wfc" ]] || [[ "$HOME_OWNER" == "$CURRENT_USER" ]]; then
   371→    pass "Home dir ownership" "$HOME_OWNER"
   372→else
   373→    fail "Home dir ownership" "$HOME_OWNER (expected wfc)"
   374→fi
   375→
   376→# ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
   377→# SUMMARY
   378→# ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
   379→printf "\n"
   380→printf "${BOLD}${BLUE}══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}\n"
   381→printf "${BOLD}  RESULTS${NC}\n"
   382→printf "${BOLD}${BLUE}══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}\n"
   383→printf "\n"
   384→printf "  ${GREEN}✓ Passed:${NC}   %d\n" "$PASS"
   385→printf "  ${YELLOW}⚠ Warnings:${NC} %d\n" "$WARN"
   386→printf "  ${RED}✗ Failed:${NC}   %d\n" "$FAIL"
   387→printf "\n"
   388→
   389→TOTAL=$((PASS + FAIL + WARN))
   390→if [[ "$FAIL" -eq 0 ]] && [[ "$WARN" -eq 0 ]]; then
   391→    printf "  ${BOLD}${GREEN}██ PERFECT — All %d checks passed. World Fucking Class. ██${NC}\n" "$TOTAL"
   392→    EXIT_CODE=0
   393→elif [[ "$FAIL" -eq 0 ]]; then
   394→    printf "  ${BOLD}${GREEN}██ PASS — %d/%d critical checks passed ██${NC}\n" "$PASS" "$TOTAL"
   395→    printf "  ${DIM}%d warnings (optional tools or non-critical)${NC}\n" "$WARN"
   396→    if [[ "$STRICT" == "--strict" ]]; then
   397→        EXIT_CODE=1
   398→    else
   399→        EXIT_CODE=0
   400→    fi
   401→else
   402→    printf "  ${BOLD}${RED}██ FAIL — %d critical checks failed ██${NC}\n" "$FAIL"
   403→    printf "  ${DIM}Fix the failures above before using this container.${NC}\n"
   404→    EXIT_CODE=1
   405→fi
   406→
   407→printf "\n"
   408→exit $EXIT_CODE
   409→

1→#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2→#
     3→# WFC DevContainer Setup Script (Linux/Mac)
     4→#
     5→# This script sets up the dev environment on the host machine
     6→# and prepares the .env file with user-specific configuration.
     7→#
     8→# Architecture: Modular design with single-responsibility modules
     9→# See scripts/lib/ for individual modules
    10→#
    11→
    12→set -euo pipefail
    13→
    14→# Get script directory for sourcing modules
    15→SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
    16→
    17→# Source all library modules
    18→source "$SCRIPT_DIR/scripts/lib/colors.sh"
    19→source "$SCRIPT_DIR/scripts/lib/validate.sh"
    20→source "$SCRIPT_DIR/scripts/lib/docker.sh"
    21→source "$SCRIPT_DIR/scripts/lib/config.sh"
    22→source "$SCRIPT_DIR/scripts/lib/mounts.sh"
    23→
    24→# ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
    25→# Main Setup Workflow
    26→# ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
    27→
    28→echo -e "${BLUE}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
    29→echo -e "${BLUE}  WFC DevContainer Setup${NC}"
    30→echo -e "${BLUE}  World Fucking Class Development Environment${NC}"
    31→echo -e "${BLUE}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
    32→echo ""
    33→
    34→# Step 1: Check Docker prerequisites
    35→if ! check_docker_prerequisites; then
    36→    exit 1
    37→fi
    38→
    39→# Step 2: Collect user configuration
    40→collect_user_configuration
    41→
    42→# Step 3: Generate .env file
    43→generate_env_file
    44→
    45→# Step 4: Collect folder mount configuration
    46→collect_mount_configuration
    47→
    48→# Step 5: Generate docker-compose.override.yml
    49→generate_mount_config
    50→
    51→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    52→# Build and start container
    53→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    54→
    55→echo -e "${GREEN}Step 5: Build and start container${NC}"
    56→echo ""
    57→echo "This will:"
    58→echo "  1. Build the Docker image (may take 3-5 minutes first time)"
    59→echo "  2. Start the devcontainer"
    60→echo "  3. Initialize the firewall in ${FIREWALL_MODE} mode"
    61→echo ""
    62→
    63→if prompt_yes_no "Proceed with build and startup?"; then
    64→    echo ""
    65→    echo "Building Docker image..."
    66→    docker compose -f .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml -f .devcontainer/docker-compose.override.yml build
    67→
    68→    echo ""
    69→    echo "Starting container..."
    70→    docker compose -f .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml -f .devcontainer/docker-compose.override.yml up -d
    71→
    72→    echo ""
    73→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓${NC} Container is starting!"
    74→    echo ""
    75→    echo "Wait a few seconds for services to initialize..."
    76→    sleep 5
    77→
    78→    # Show status
    79→    docker compose -f .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml ps
    80→fi
    81→
    82→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    83→# Setup complete
    84→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    85→
    86→echo ""
    87→echo -e "${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
    88→echo -e "${GREEN}  Setup Complete! ${NC}"
    89→echo -e "${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
    90→echo ""
    91→echo "Next steps:"
    92→echo ""
    93→echo "1. Open in VS Code:"
    94→echo "   code ."
    95→echo ""
    96→echo "2. When prompted, click 'Reopen in Container'"
    97→echo ""
    98→echo "3. Or manually attach:"
    99→echo "   - F1 → 'Dev Containers: Attach to Running Container'"
   100→echo "   - Select 'wfc-devcontainer'"
   101→echo ""
   102→echo "4. Firewall mode: $FIREWALL_MODE"
   103→if [[ "$FIREWALL_MODE" == "audit" ]]; then
   104→    echo "   View traffic: sudo tail -f /var/log/kern.log | grep FW-AUDIT"
   105→fi
   106→echo ""
   107→echo "5. WFC Skills available inside container:"
   108→echo "   /wfc-build     - Build features"
   109→echo "   /wfc-review    - Multi-agent consensus review"
   110→echo "   /wfc-plan      - Structured planning"
   111→echo "   /wfc-security  - STRIDE threat modeling"
   112→echo ""
   113→echo -e "${BLUE}World Fucking Class.${NC}"
   114→echo ""
   115→

content.content:
1→name: CI
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    branches: [ main ]
     6→  pull_request:
     7→    branches: [ main ]
     8→
     9→jobs:
    10→  lint:
    11→    name: Lint & Format Check
    12→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    13→    steps:
    14→      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    15→
    16→      - name: Set up Python
    17→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    18→        with:
    19→          python-version: '3.12'
    20→
    21→      - name: Cache dependencies
    22→        uses: actions/cache@v4
    23→        with:
    24→          path: ~/.cache/pip
    25→          key: ${{ runner.os }}-pip-${{ hashFiles('**/pyproject.toml') }}
    26→          restore-keys: |
    27→            ${{ runner.os }}-pip-
    28→
    29→      - name: Install dependencies
    30→        run: |
    31→          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
    32→          pip install black ruff mypy
    33→          pip install pytest pytest-cov
    34→
    35→      - name: Run black
    36→        run: black --check --diff wfc/
    37→
    38→      - name: Run ruff
    39→        run: ruff check wfc/
    40→
    41→      - name: Run mypy
    42→        run: mypy wfc/ --ignore-missing-imports || true
    43→
    44→  test:
    45→    name: Test Suite
    46→    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    47→    strategy:
    48→      matrix:
    49→        os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest]
    50→        python-version: ['3.12']
    51→
    52→    steps:
    53→      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    54→
    55→      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
    56→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    57→        with:
    58→          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
    59→
    60→      - name: Install dependencies
    61→        run: |
    62→          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
    63→          pip install pytest pytest-cov
    64→          pip install -e .
    65→
    66→      - name: Install WFC skills
    67→        run: |
    68→          mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills
    69→          chmod +x install.sh
    70→          ./install.sh --ci
    71→
    72→      - name: Run tests
    73→        run: |
    74→          pytest tests/ -v --cov=wfc --cov-report=xml
    75→
    76→      - name: Upload coverage
    77→        if: matrix.python-version == '3.12' && matrix.os == 'ubuntu-latest'
    78→        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v4
    79→        with:
    80→          files: ./coverage.xml
    81→          flags: unittests
    82→          name: codecov-wfc
    83→
    84→  validate-personas:
    85→    name: Validate Persona Library
    86→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    87→    steps:
    88→      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    89→
    90→      - name: Set up Python
    91→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    92→        with:
    93→          python-version: '3.12'
    94→
    95→      - name: Validate JSON files
    96→        run: |
    97→          python3 << 'EOF'
    98→          import json
    99→          from pathlib import Path
   100→
   101→          panels_dir = Path('wfc/references/personas/panels')
   102→          errors = []
   103→
   104→          for persona_file in panels_dir.glob('*/*.json'):
   105→              try:
   106→                  with open(persona_file) as f:
   107→                      data = json.load(f)
   108→                      # Basic validation
   109→                      required_fields = ['id', 'name', 'panel', 'skills', 'lens', 'selection_criteria']
   110→                      missing = [field for field in required_fields if field not in data]
   111→                      if missing:
   112→                          errors.append(f"{persona_file}: Missing fields: {missing}")
   113→              except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
   114→                  errors.append(f"{persona_file}: Invalid JSON: {e}")
   115→              except Exception as e:
   116→                  errors.append(f"{persona_file}: Error: {e}")
   117→
   118→          if errors:
   119→              print("❌ Persona validation errors:")
   120→              for error in errors:
   121→                  print(f"  - {error}")
   122→              exit(1)
   123→          else:
   124→              persona_count = len(list(panels_dir.glob('*/*.json')))
   125→              print(f"✅ All {persona_count} personas validated successfully")
   126→          EOF
   127→
   128→      - name: Check model aliases
   129→        run: |
   130→          python3 << 'EOF'
   131→          import json
   132→          from pathlib import Path
   133→
   134→          panels_dir = Path('wfc/references/personas/panels')
   135→          allowed_models = ['opus', 'sonnet', 'haiku']
   136→          errors = []
   137→
   138→          for persona_file in panels_dir.glob('*/*.json'):
   139→              with open(persona_file) as f:
   140→                  data = json.load(f)
   141→                  model_pref = data.get('model_preference', {}).get('default', '')
   142→                  if model_pref not in allowed_models:
   143→                      errors.append(f"{persona_file}: Invalid model '{model_pref}' (use: {allowed_models})")
   144→
   145→          if errors:
   146→              print("❌ Model alias errors:")
   147→              for error in errors:
   148→                  print(f"  - {error}")
   149→              exit(1)
   150→          else:
   151→              print("✅ All personas use valid model aliases")
   152→          EOF
   153→
   154→  build:
   155→    name: Build Check
   156→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   157→    needs: [lint, test, validate-personas]
   158→    steps:
   159→      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   160→
   161→      - name: Set up Python
   162→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
   163→        with:
   164→          python-version: '3.12'
   165→
   166→      - name: Install build tools
   167→        run: |
   168→          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
   169→          pip install build twine
   170→
   171→      - name: Build package
   172→        run: python -m build
   173→
   174→      - name: Check package
   175→        run: twine check dist/*
   176→
   177→      - name: Test installation
   178→        run: |
   179→          pip install dist/*.whl
   180→          python -c "import sys; print('✅ Package installs successfully')"
   181→
   182→  install-test:
   183→    name: Test Install Script
   184→    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
   185→    strategy:
   186→      matrix:
   187→        os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest]
   188→
   189→    steps:
   190→      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   191→
   192→      - name: Create mock Claude directory
   193→        run: mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills
   194→
   195→      - name: Test install script
   196→        run: |
   197→          chmod +x install.sh
   198→          ./install.sh <<< '2'
   199→
   200→      - name: Verify installation
   201→        run: |
   202→          # Check framework installed
   203→          [ -d ~/.claude/skills/wfc ] || (echo "❌ Framework not installed" && exit 1)
   204→
   205→          # Check skills flattened
   206→          skill_count=$(ls -d ~/.claude/skills/wfc-* 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
   207→          if [ "$skill_count" -lt 10 ]; then
   208→              echo "❌ Skills not properly flattened (found $skill_count, expected ≥10)"
   209→              exit 1
   210→          fi
   211→
   212→          # Check persona library
   213→          persona_count=$(find ~/.claude/skills/wfc/references/personas/panels -name "*.json" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
   214→          if [ "$persona_count" -lt 50 ]; then
   215→              echo "❌ Persona library incomplete (found $persona_count, expected ≥50)"
   216→              exit 1
   217→          fi
   218→
   219→          echo "✅ Installation verified: $skill_count skills, $persona_count personas"
   220→

content.content:
1→name: Quick Check
     2→
     3→# Fast validation workflow - runs on every push
     4→# Optimized for speed: ~30 seconds vs full CI ~3-5 minutes
     5→
     6→on:
     7→  push:
     8→    branches: ["*"]
     9→  pull_request:
    10→    branches: [main]
    11→
    12→jobs:
    13→  quick-check:
    14→    name: Fast Validation
    15→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    16→    timeout-minutes: 5
    17→
    18→    steps:
    19→      - name: Checkout code
    20→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    21→
    22→      - name: Set up Python
    23→        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    24→        with:
    25→          python-version: "3.12"
    26→
    27→      - name: Install UV
    28→        run: |
    29→          curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
    30→          echo "$HOME/.cargo/bin" >> $GITHUB_PATH
    31→
    32→      - name: Install dependencies (minimal)
    33→        run: |
    34→          uv pip install --system -e ".[dev]"
    35→
    36→      - name: Install WFC skills
    37→        run: |
    38→          mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills
    39→          chmod +x install.sh
    40→          ./install.sh --ci
    41→
    42→      - name: Format check (black)
    43→        run: |
    44→          black --check --diff wfc/
    45→        continue-on-error: false
    46→
    47→      - name: Lint (ruff)
    48→        run: |
    49→          ruff check wfc/
    50→        continue-on-error: false
    51→
    52→      - name: Quick smoke tests (fast tests only)
    53→        run: |
    54→          # Run only fast unit tests (skip integration/e2e)
    55→          pytest tests/ -m "not slow and not e2e" -v --tb=short || true
    56→        continue-on-error: true
    57→
    58→      - name: Check imports
    59→        run: |
    60→          python -c "
    61→          import sys
    62→          sys.path.insert(0, '.')
    63→
    64→          # Quick import check of critical modules
    65→          from wfc.scripts.confidence_checker import ConfidenceChecker
    66→          from wfc.scripts.memory_manager import MemoryManager
    67→          from wfc.scripts.token_manager import TokenManager
    68→          from wfc.scripts.universal_quality_checker import UniversalQualityChecker
    69→
    70→          print('✅ All critical imports successful')
    71→          "
    72→
    73→      - name: Summary
    74→        if: always()
    75→        run: |
    76→          echo "=========================================="
    77→          echo "Quick Check Complete"
    78→          echo "=========================================="
    79→          echo "Format: ${{ steps.format-check.outcome }}"
    80→          echo "Lint: ${{ steps.lint.outcome }}"
    81→          echo "=========================================="

content.content:
1→name: Validate WFC Skills
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    branches: [ main ]
     6→  pull_request:
     7→    branches: [ main ]
     8→
     9→jobs:
    10→  test:
    11→    name: Run Tests
    12→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    13→
    14→    steps:
    15→    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    16→
    17→    - name: Set up Python
    18→      uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    19→      with:
    20→        python-version: '3.12'
    21→
    22→    - name: Install uv
    23→      run: |
    24→        curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
    25→        echo "$HOME/.cargo/bin" >> $GITHUB_PATH
    26→
    27→    - name: Install dependencies
    28→      run: |
    29→        uv venv
    30→        source .venv/bin/activate
    31→        uv pip install -e ".[dev,tokens]"
    32→
    33→    - name: Install WFC skills
    34→      run: |
    35→        mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills
    36→        chmod +x install.sh
    37→        ./install.sh --ci
    38→
    39→    - name: Run tests
    40→      run: |
    41→        source .venv/bin/activate
    42→        pytest -v
    43→
    44→    - name: Check formatting
    45→      run: |
    46→        source .venv/bin/activate
    47→        black --check wfc/
    48→
    49→    - name: Run linter
    50→      run: |
    51→        source .venv/bin/activate
    52→        ruff check wfc/
    53→
    54→  validate-skills:
    55→    name: Validate Agent Skills Compliance
    56→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    57→
    58→    steps:
    59→    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    60→
    61→    - name: Set up Python
    62→      uses: actions/setup-python@v5
    63→      with:
    64→        python-version: '3.12'
    65→
    66→    - name: Install WFC skills
    67→      run: |
    68→        mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills
    69→        chmod +x install.sh
    70→        ./install.sh --ci
    71→
    72→    - name: Install validation dependencies
    73→      run: pip install pyyaml
    74→
    75→    # Validates SKILL.md per Agent Skills spec (https://github.com/anthropics/skills)
    76→    # Checks: YAML frontmatter (name, description), skill body content, naming convention,
    77→    # and XML prompt rendering. Note: the original `skills-ref` validator from
    78→    # anthropics/agentskills is not publicly available; this implements equivalent checks
    79→    # based on the Agent Skills spec at https://agentskills.io/specification.
    80→    - name: Validate all WFC skills
    81→      run: |
    82→        python3 << 'PYEOF'
    83→        import yaml
    84→        import os
    85→        import sys
    86→        import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
    87→
    88→        skills_dir = os.path.expanduser("~/.claude/skills")
    89→        failed = False
    90→        validated = 0
    91→
    92→        for entry in sorted(os.listdir(skills_dir)):
    93→            if not entry.startswith("wfc-"):
    94→                continue
    95→            skill_dir = os.path.join(skills_dir, entry)
    96→            if not os.path.isdir(skill_dir):
    97→                continue
    98→
    99→            skill_md = os.path.join(skill_dir, "SKILL.md")
   100→            if not os.path.exists(skill_md):
   101→                print(f"❌ {entry}: missing SKILL.md")
   102→                failed = True
   103→                continue
   104→
   105→            with open(skill_md) as f:
   106→                content = f.read()
   107→
   108→            # Check YAML frontmatter
   109→            if not content.startswith("---"):
   110→                print(f"❌ {entry}: SKILL.md missing YAML frontmatter")
   111→                failed = True
   112→                continue
   113→
   114→            parts = content.split("---", 2)
   115→            if len(parts) < 3:
   116→                print(f"❌ {entry}: SKILL.md has malformed frontmatter")
   117→                failed = True
   118→                continue
   119→
   120→            try:
   121→                meta = yaml.safe_load(parts[1])
   122→            except yaml.YAMLError as e:
   123→                print(f"❌ {entry}: invalid YAML frontmatter: {e}")
   124→                failed = True
   125→                continue
   126→
   127→            # Validate required fields per Agent Skills spec
   128→            if not meta or not isinstance(meta, dict):
   129→                print(f"❌ {entry}: empty frontmatter")
   130→                failed = True
   131→                continue
   132→
   133→            missing = [f for f in ["name", "description"] if f not in meta]
   134→            if missing:
   135→                print(f"❌ {entry}: missing required fields: {missing}")
   136→                failed = True
   137→                continue
   138→
   139→            # Validate naming convention (lowercase, hyphens)
   140→            name = meta["name"]
   141→            if name != name.lower() or " " in name:
   142→                print(f"❌ {entry}: name '{name}' must be lowercase with hyphens")
   143→                failed = True
   144→                continue
   145→
   146→            # Validate skill body has meaningful content
   147→            body = parts[2].strip()
   148→            if len(body) < 50:
   149→                print(f"❌ {entry}: SKILL.md body too short ({len(body)} chars)")
   150→                failed = True
   151→                continue
   152→
   153→            # Validate XML prompt rendering
   154→            try:
   155→                xml_str = f"<skill><name>{name}</name><description>{meta['description']}</description><content>{body[:200]}</content></skill>"
   156→                ET.fromstring(xml_str)
   157→            except ET.ParseError as e:
   158→                print(f"⚠️  {entry}: XML prompt rendering warning: {e}")
   159→
   160→            validated += 1
   161→            print(f"✅ {entry}: valid (name={name})")
   162→
   163→        if failed:
   164→            print(f"\n❌ Some skills failed validation")
   165→            sys.exit(1)
   166→        else:
   167→            print(f"\n✅ All {validated} WFC skills validated")
   168→        PYEOF
   169→
   170→  benchmark:
   171→    name: Token Usage Benchmark
   172→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   173→
   174→    steps:
   175→    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   176→
   177→    - name: Set up Python
   178→      uses: actions/setup-python@v5
   179→      with:
   180→        python-version: '3.12'
   181→
   182→    - name: Install uv
   183→      run: |
   184→        curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
   185→        echo "$HOME/.cargo/bin" >> $GITHUB_PATH
   186→
   187→    - name: Install dependencies
   188→      run: |
   189→        uv venv
   190→        source .venv/bin/activate
   191→        uv pip install -e ".[tokens]"
   192→
   193→    - name: Run benchmark
   194→      run: |
   195→        source .venv/bin/activate
   196→        python scripts/benchmark_tokens.py --compare
   197→

content.content:
1→#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2→#
     3→# WFC DevContainer Firewall Configuration
     4→#
     5→# AUDIT MODE: Logs all connection attempts without blocking
     6→# - Set FIREWALL_MODE=audit to see what gets accessed
     7→# - Set FIREWALL_MODE=enforce to block non-whitelisted traffic
     8→#
     9→# Implements multi-layered security approach with precise access control:
    10→# - Whitelisted outbound connections only (npm registry, GitHub, PyPI, etc.)
    11→# - Allows DNS and SSH connections
    12→# - Default-deny policy for all other external network access
    13→# - Startup verification of firewall rules
    14→#
    15→
    16→set -euo pipefail
    17→
    18→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    19→# Configuration
    20→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    21→
    22→# FIREWALL_MODE: "audit" or "enforce"
    23→# - audit:   Log all connections, don't block (see what Claude needs)
    24→# - enforce: Block non-whitelisted connections (production mode)
    25→FIREWALL_MODE="${FIREWALL_MODE:-audit}"
    26→
    27→echo "Configuring WFC DevContainer firewall..."
    28→echo "   Mode: ${FIREWALL_MODE}"
    29→
    30→# Colors
    31→RED='\033[0;31m'
    32→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    33→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    34→BLUE='\033[0;34m'
    35→NC='\033[0m'
    36→
    37→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    38→# Check if running as root (required for firewall rules)
    39→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    40→if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
    41→    echo -e "${RED}Error: This script must be run as root${NC}"
    42→    echo "Please run with sudo or configure in devcontainer.json with privileged mode"
    43→    exit 1
    44→fi
    45→
    46→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    47→# Install iptables if not present
    48→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    49→if ! command -v iptables &> /dev/null; then
    50→    echo "Installing iptables..."
    51→    apt-get update
    52→    apt-get install -y iptables
    53→fi
    54→
    55→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    56→# Define firewall policies
    57→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    58→
    59→# Flush existing rules
    60→iptables -F
    61→iptables -X
    62→iptables -Z
    63→
    64→if [[ "$FIREWALL_MODE" == "audit" ]]; then
    65→    echo -e "${YELLOW}  AUDIT MODE: Logging all traffic, NOT blocking${NC}"
    66→    # In audit mode: Allow everything, but log it
    67→    iptables -P INPUT ACCEPT
    68→    iptables -P FORWARD DROP
    69→    iptables -P OUTPUT ACCEPT
    70→else
    71→    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ ENFORCE MODE: Blocking non-whitelisted traffic${NC}"
    72→    # In enforce mode: Default deny
    73→    iptables -P INPUT DROP
    74→    iptables -P FORWARD DROP
    75→    iptables -P OUTPUT DROP
    76→fi
    77→
    78→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    79→# Allow loopback traffic (localhost communication)
    80→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    81→iptables -A INPUT -i lo -j ACCEPT
    82→iptables -A OUTPUT -o lo -j ACCEPT
    83→
    84→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    85→# Allow established and related connections
    86→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    87→iptables -A INPUT -m state --state ESTABLISHED,RELATED -j ACCEPT
    88→
    89→if [[ "$FIREWALL_MODE" == "enforce" ]]; then
    90→    iptables -A OUTPUT -m state --state ESTABLISHED,RELATED -j ACCEPT
    91→fi
    92→
    93→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    94→# Allow DNS queries (essential for package management and development)
    95→# ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    96→if [[ "$FIREWALL_MODE" == "audit" ]]; then
    97→    iptables -A OUTPUT -p udp --dport 53 -j LOG --log-prefix "[FW-AUDIT] DNS: " --log-level 6
    98→    iptables -A OUTPUT -p tcp --dport 53 -j LOG --log-prefix "[FW-AUDIT] DNS: " --log-level 6
    99→fi
   100→iptables -A OUTPUT -p udp --dport 53 -j ACCEPT
